column4: Hi - I am trying to set up hamachi - It has created a ham0 interface and given me an IP, which I can ping - but when I attempt to ping someone else on my hamachi vpn via their hamachi interface IP, I get 'ping: sendmsg: Operation not permitted' - anyone got any ideas what might be wrong?
I have run    sudo ufw disable
check what do you have first
well, that stopped me from being able to ping anything and dropped my network :) reconnected and now I can ping things and myself, but still not another machine on the hamachi vpn
you are trying to ping on gateway or from internal network ?
check on your peer ham interface with tcpdump
this is my system config http://pastebin.com/LqwA8v69
can someone help me to figure why I have no dsp in my system

I cant ping myself again, operation not permitted - tcpdump of that interface gives nothing because I cant ping myself - setup is two PC's on the same network, one ethernet one wifi, both ubuntu, hamachi installed and connected to a vpn created through hamachi
do you have admin permissions on that hosts ?
logged in as root on both
